item.title: nvim: Unable to create directory for swap file - recovery impossible: permission denied
item.description: I was playing around with neovim last week and despite installing it via Homebrew, ran into a weird permissions error. In this blog post, Iâ€™ll describe the problem I had and how to solve it. I installed it like this: brew install nvim And then tried to create a new file: nvim foo.py Which resulted in the following error: Output E303: Unable to create directory "/Users/markhneedham/.local/state/nvim" for swap file, recovery impossible: permission denied E303: Unable to open swap file for "foo.
